title: Hilbert scheme
summary: In algebraic geometry, a branch of mathematics, a Hilbert scheme is a scheme that is the parameter space for the closed subschemes of some projective space (or a more general projective scheme), refining the Chow variety.  The Hilbert scheme is a disjoint union of projective subschemes corresponding to Hilbert polynomials. The basic theory of Hilbert schemes was developed by Alexander GrothendieckÂ (1961). Hironaka's example shows that non-projective varieties need not have Hilbert schemes.
